speaker: Best-Edited Half-Hour Series for Television
text: Timothy Mozer  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Timothy Mozer   * * *   **This is Part One:[[3.06]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_6/sleeping_with_the_enemy.html "Sleeping With The Enemy")**  * * *  ## Transcript {simon aw}

speaker: Daphne
text: [_v.o._] Previously on _Frasier_... _This episode is the second in a two-parter (the first being "Sleeping With The Enemy," and begins with a montage of four clips from the previous episode:  - Roz telling Frasier that Kate has cancelled the KACL staffers' annual pay raise;  - Frasier and Kate arguing and then kissing;  - Martin suggesting to Frasier that Kate may have been trying to manipulate him;  - Finally, Frasier and Kate negotiating and then kissing, again.  FADE TO:  ACT ONE  Scene One - Cafe Nervosa Niles has just been served his coffee.  He is walking away from the bar when he sees Frasier entering._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn, I didn't think you'd be here...

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I would've gone to my regular haunt, but "The Pig 'N Swig" is closed for remodelling. _He sits down at a free table with his back to the doorway, and is joined by Frasier, who settles opposite him._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, it's just... I'm meeting Kate here.  We want to discuss the little dilemma in which we find ourselves.

speaker: Niles
text: If you're talking about the little kiss you two shared, that hardly constitutes a dilemma.  It's not as if you plunged into a tawdry office affair.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Then you'd have a real problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: A kiss?  It's _nothing_.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking somewhat uncomfortable_] Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Had _sex_ with her, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't mean to!  It just... happened!  One minute we were negotiating, the next minute our inhibitions were shattered, along with my kneecap and her Macintosh PowerBook.

speaker: Niles
text: [_surprised_] This happened in her office?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: What are you saying?  Her couch folds out?

speaker: Frasier
text: We used her desk.

speaker: Niles
text: Her desk folds out?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles, anxious_] There she is!  Look, look, just make an excuse and go, okay? [_stands up_]

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, okay. [_to Kate_] Ah, Miss Costas. [_stands up_]

speaker: Kate
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: [_glances at his watch_] Oh, look at the time!  I, er, have a session with my multiple personality.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not to worry.  If I'm late he can just talk amongst himself. [_laughs_]

speaker: Kate
text: So... good morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning.

speaker: Kate
text: How's your knee?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Well er, it's better, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: And... and your laptop? [_off her confused look_] I refer to your computer.

speaker: Kate
text: A little dented, but fine. [_smiles_] The computer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Anyway, what I wanted to tell you was that, well, last night was one of the greatest nights of lovemaking I've had since... Roz!

speaker: Kate
text: Tell me she just walked in.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, hi!  Guess you guys kissed and made up, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Well, in a manner of speaking, yes.  We were just discussing the step system in a new healthcare plans co- payment scheme and... well, it wouldn't interest you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, the hell it wouldn't! [_sits at their table_] You know they're too cheap to pay for a butt-lift?  I sit on this thing all day long, that's work-related!

speaker: Kate
text: Listen, I really have to go, but I would like to discuss this matter at the first possible opportunity.

speaker: Frasier
text: So would I.

speaker: Kate
text: [_turns to leave, but stops_] Oh, oh, oh, oh, I almost forgot. I need you two to fill in the eight-to-ten slot tonight. Floyd, the Happy Chef, is in rehab again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  [_N.B. In other episodes, the Happy Chef's name has been given as Leo._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_fed up_] Oh, great!  I was supposed to have dinner with a successful, handsome doctor! [_Frasier sits down again_] She thinks we're all as happy to work all night as she is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're a psychiatrist, Frasier.  She's a cold, repressed workaholic who has no sex life whatsoever.  Can't you help her?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_deadpan_] I've tried, Roz. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. Martin is in The Armchair reading a newspaper; Daphne is at the dining table doing some ironing; Eddie is sitting on one of the chairs at the dining table.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] Why do we bother having a service elevator?  I just rode up nineteen floors with two sweaty moving men munching on chili-dogs which they proceeded to drip onto my suede shoes. [_looks down and points_] How will I ever get that stain out? _Eddie jumps off his chair, runs over to Frasier, and licks the chili off helpfully._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes.  Dog saliva!  Nature's miracle solvent. [_hangs up his coat_] So who's moving out anyway?

speaker: Daphne
text: Deirdre Sauvage, the one who writes the romance novels.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, the lost Gabor sister's finally outta here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, she's a very sweet person and I'm going to miss her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're not the one she's always undressing with her eyes.  She lured me into her apartment one time, supposedly to fix a lamp.  Next thing I know, I got a drink in my hand and she's reading me a dirty poem about meadow walks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I must admit she's never done that to me.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah well, if she does, don't fake a charley horse to get outta there.  She'll just try to rub it!

speaker: Daphne
text: Speaking of romance, Dr. Crane... when I washed your shirt this morning, I couldn't help noticing lipstick in the oddest places.  I'll take it negotiations went well last night...?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd rather not discuss it, thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Why, is there a problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: Things between me and Kate just went a little faster than I intended.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say!  There were also four buttons missing, and teeth- marks in the shoulders!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Inspector Moon!  Things got a little out of hand. I think we should slow down a bit but er, I'm afraid to tell her for fear of hurting her feelings.  Daphne, how about a woman's perspective?  Let's just say, for argument's sake, that you and I succumbed to a, a night of passion...

speaker: Daphne
text: What, you and me? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes...

speaker: Daphne
text: What - bosoms heaving, shirt buttons catapulting through the air?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a hypothetical question!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll say it is! [_laughs again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, alright, somebody else!  Alright?  So, you have a, a mad tryst with this young man, and then the next day he says that he thinks things are going too fast; he'd like to slow down. What would you say?

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose I'd say, "Thanks for being honest.  You're probably right, we were moving too fast." [_suddenly bitter_] "Not that it was too fast for you last night.  Ohh, no, we were right on schedule then, weren't we?" [_seemingly in her own world_] "But, now you've had your fun - though not too much, apparently -- and you want to be my friend.  Well you can just sod off, Trevor Mulgrew!!!"

speaker: Daphne
text: [_shaky_] You know, I think I might have some buttons for this shirt...

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, dad - the whole thing's a minefield.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, you'll never learn, will you?  Handling a woman's easy!

speaker: Martin
text: You know, you kill me.  Mister Psychiatrist, you've always gotta make everything so complicated.  A woman comes on too strong, you just tell her to cool her engines!  It's the easiest thing in the world.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opens the door_] Oh, Deirdre!  _As soon as he hears this, Martin leaps out of The Armchair and heads for his room, terrified._

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand you're leaving us.

speaker: Deirdre
text: [_British accent_] Alas, yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, do come in!

speaker: Deirdre
text: Thank you.  _She enters.  Deirdre is a not-greatly-attractive, middle-aged woman in blue attire._  [_N.B. "Deirdre Sauvage" is the name of a romance novelist character in one of Joe Keenan's early novels, "Blue Heaven."_] _Martin is almost out of the room when Deirdre sees him.  Naturally, he has to give up - and disguise - his escape attempt._

speaker: Deirdre
text: [_excited_] Ohhh hello, Martin!

speaker: Deirdre
text: You've been so kind to me - I wanted to give you my new address.  _She gives him a piece of paper, which he accepts with much-feigned enthusiasm._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great!  I'd hate to lose touch!

speaker: Deirdre
text: I also wanted to bring you a farewell gift: my latest novel, "Foolish Escapade."  It's the long-awaited sequel to "The Rose and the Rapier."  _She gives him a paperback book, which he accepts in the same manner as before._

speaker: Martin
text: Swell!

speaker: Deirdre
text: [_starts to stroke Martin's arm, flirtatiously_] I was er, thinking of you when I created the character of Lorenzo, the lovesick gondolier...

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] How 'bout that?  Hah!  Hey, where are my manners? Let me show you out!  _He takes her arm and tries to lead her towards the doorway, but she stays put._

speaker: Deirdre
text: Oh, by the way, the lock on my suitcase is jammed.  I was er, hoping that you'd come and... [_strokes Martin's face, very flirtatiously_] _tinker_ with it?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh gee, you know, I'd love to, Deirdre.  But I, I promised Frasier I'd do something with him tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh oh, dad, didn't I mention it?  I'm filling in for The Happy Chef tonight... _Martin, his back to Deirdre, furiously mouths, "SHUT UP!  SHUT UP! SHUT UP!"_

speaker: Frasier
text: ...so, you're all hers!

speaker: Deirdre
text: [_thrilled_] Oh, marvelous!  _She grabs him by the arm and drags him out.  Martin has enough time to give Frasier a look that combines rage and terror._

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight, Lorenzo.  _He closes the door.  FADE TO:_  **THE ADVENTURES OF BAD BOY AND DIRTY GIRL**  _Scene Three - KACL. Frasier is in the studio.  Roz, who is dressed for a night out, is in her booth, busy putting on make-up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Polly.  How can I help you?

speaker: Polly
text: [_v.o._] Oh, I'm so glad I got through!  I'm sitting here not knowing what to do.  I find myself lacking a certain spice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Polly, if you want to shake up your routine, why don't you er, try something new and dangerous?  Er, skydiving, belly-dancing, perhaps?  That ought to add some spice.

speaker: Polly
text: What are you talking about?!  I'm making an apple tart and I'm out of cinnamon!

speaker: Frasier
text: I see. [_disconnects her_] Listeners, for the fourth time this hour, I am NOT The Happy Chef.  I am The Irritated Psychiatrist, Dr. Frasier Crane!  We'll be right back after the news.  _Roz grimaces as Frasier gets up and enters her booth.  Obviously, she has been less than attentive to her call-screening duties._

speaker: Frasier
text: And while we're on the subject of tarts...

speaker: Roz
text: I'm really sorry about that call.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's alright, Roz.  Why don't you just run along for your date?  I can handle the last ten minutes here.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure!

speaker: Roz
text: I mean, I feel terrible leaving you here alone in the lurch. [_whisks her coat off the back of her chair and rushes to the door_] We are a team, Frasier; you just say the word and I'll stay... [_shouts_] Hey, hold that elevator! _She leaves hurriedly.  Frasier shuts the side door.  Kate enters the studio._

speaker: Kate
text: Got a minute?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes.  Er, look, I, I'm glad you're still here. [_closes the door to the booth_]  Er, listen...

speaker: Kate
text: No-no-no, me first this time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Kate
text: [_clears throat_] I really think that we should slow things down.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relieved_] Oh, I am so glad you said that!  I wanted to say the same thing but I was, I was afraid that you'd feel I was rejecting you!

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, how sensitive.  And yet, at the same time, how full of yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_amused_] You are one tough nut, lady.

speaker: Kate
text: [_relaxed_] Well, all this definitely shows we're doing the right thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Agreed.  Frankly, now that we've got that settled, do you mind if I ask you a question about last night?

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell was that?!

speaker: Kate
text: I have no idea!  I... ever since I've gotten here, you have done nothing but irritate me like a persistent skin rash.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and you me!  And, and, and last night was no different. You just kept talking and talking and talking, and I guess that mouth of yours just ticked me off so much I just had to have it!

speaker: Kate
text: The whole thing... it's just, it's so primitive!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, yeah, animal!  We were just functioning on instinct.

speaker: Kate
text: It's fascinating, really.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, let's not dismiss the element of danger - all those people outside that could have walked in any moment and caught us.

speaker: Kate
text: That crossed my mind...

speaker: Frasier
text: For once, in my cautious, buttoned-down life, I felt like a real bad boy.

speaker: Kate
text: [_sheepish_] I felt like a...dirty girl.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_intrigued_] What did you just call yourself?

speaker: Kate
text: [_unashamed_] I said "dirty girl."

speaker: Kate
text: [_flirtatious_] You bad boy. [_grins excitedly_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_aroused and mock-disapproving_] You dirty girl.

speaker: Kate
text: [_sexily_] You bad boy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dirty girl!

speaker: Kate
text: [_whispers_] Bad boy...!!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited_] Dirty girl...!!  _They kiss, violently.  Cut to outside the studio, looking in through the window; we see Frasier and Kate anxiously stagger to the window and close the blinds.  Cut back to inside.  Still holding each other, they bump up against the studio console and lie on top of it, snogging rabidly._

speaker: Kate
text: [_urgent_] How much time do we have left on the news?

speaker: Frasier
text: Three minutes. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Kate
text: Right... [_kisses him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: But that's alright, I can play lots of extra commercials! [_kisses her_]

speaker: Kate
text: Oh good, [_kisses him_] good!  _CUT TO: Frasier's apartment.  Martin and Daphne are sitting at the dining table, playing dominoes; Eddie is on a chair near them.  The radio is on and tuned to KACL._

speaker: Newscast
text: [_on radio:_] In local news, Congressman Robert Gill was accused of accepting bribes from a waste treatment facility. Asked to comment, the congressman said-

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cuts in suddenly; orgasmic_] Yes!  YES!!!  I am a bad boy, aren't I, you dirty girl!  Come to your bad boy! _Martin and Daphne freeze and look toward the radio in shock; Eddie does the same.  CUT TO: Niles listening to this in his car, agape.  We view this through a camera on the car's bonnet, looking through the windscreen._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on radio:_] Oh, _yes_... Oh, no!  Is that the on-air light?

speaker: Kate
text: [_on radio, whispering:_] Stop talking.

speaker: Frasier
text: You must have hit the switch with your elbow while we were...

speaker: Kate
text: [_more urgent_] Stop talking!

speaker: Frasier
text: We'd better hurry up and get dressed while we still...

speaker: Niles
text: [_stares at the radio_] Stop talking! _Niles returns his attention to the road, but he has been looking away for too long.  He brakes hard, but crashes into the car in front. The airbag inflates, trapping him in his seat; he struggles weakly behind it.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **DIRTY GIRL, SIGN IN PLEASE**  _Scene One - KACL The next day, before show time.  There are several newspapers on the console.  Frasier enters, and sees Roz waiting for him with one of them in her hand._

speaker: Roz
text: [_triumphant_] Okay, Fabio, I want two things.  One: you will never make another crack about _my_ sex life.  I don't care if I start dating a lumber camp.

speaker: Frasier
text: Done.

speaker: Roz
text: And two: who's Dirty Girl? [_smiles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't tell you that.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, Frasier!  I swear, I won't tell a soul!

speaker: Roz
text: Yes? [_turns away from Frasier, lowers voice:_] Not yet, I'll call you back.  _She puts the phone down and gets a distrustful glare from Frasier. Bulldog enters._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Doc, I got one thing to say to you...

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, take your best shot.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_in genuine admiration_] I am so proud of you, man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, doesn't that just put the cherry on the parfait.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Now come on, you gotta tell me - who's the mystery chick?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, haven't you already seen? [_points to the newspapers_] I've told half a dozen reporters that I'm not going to name names.

speaker: Roz
text: [_holds up a newspaper_] Yeah, don't you see this right here? "'I Won't Fink,' Says Kinky Shrink." _Roz and Bulldog laugh; Frasier looks fed up.  Then, a rather uncomfortable-looking Kate creeps into the studio._

speaker: Kate
text: Good afternoon, Dr Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Miss Costas.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, hey, you're the boss - make him tell who his playmate was.

speaker: Kate
text: Bulldog, this is really none of your business.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, but we got a pool going.  So far, hot money's on Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!  Oh, well, thank you, but I think I have a little more self-respect than to have a quickie with a co-worker on the air!  What kind of slut do they think I am?

speaker: Kate
text: [_extremely uncomfortable_] Dr. Crane, could I have a word with you in private?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, I-I'd love that, but I, I've got my show in two minutes.

speaker: Kate
text: Actually you don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Kate
text: I'm suspending you for a week. [_to Bulldog_] Bulldog, you're going on. [_to Roz_] Roz, you'll have to produce.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Alright!  _He enthusiastically slaps Roz on the butt; she viciously hits him in the stomach with her clipboard._

speaker: Frasier
text: I must say, I find that a, a bit harsh, all things considered.

speaker: Kate
text: Yes, I can see how you might feel that way.  But the station does have certain standards and it is my job to enforce them. Now if you will excuse me, I have to meet with one of last night's sponsors - The Wholesome Family Cookie Company.  _She leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. Frasier enters.  It is pitch dark, so he presses the light switch. The lights go up and we see Martin, who had been reading a newspaper with the aid of a pen torch, sink into The Armchair in alarm._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey!  Turn those lights out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Martin
text: Deirdre hasn't finished moving yet.  If she sees the light in here, she'll know I'm home!  You can see your living room from her bedroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Her bedroom...?

speaker: Martin
text: She had me cornered in there yesterday.  I don't mind telling you, I haven't been that scared since Korea.  _Frasier turns the lights back on and Martin sinks into The Armchair again.  Frasier goes to the coat-hanger._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, dad.  Look, I have no intention of letting anyone in here tonight.  There's a damn tabloid news crew down in the lobby.  I had to go in the back way and use the service elevator. [_hangs up his coat_]

speaker: Martin
text: Say, I tuned in to your show tonight.  Why weren't you on it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sulky_] If you must know, I've been suspended for a week.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_depressed_] I spent the last three hours at the observation deck of the Space Needle, looking down on a city that's looking down on me.  _He sits on the couch and cradles his face in his hands.  Daphne enters from her room._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes.  Your father's not here either.  It's so nice having the whole house to myself.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how lovely.  Now the whole family's not here.  _She closes the door and goes to sit on the couch armrest, next to Frasier.  Niles walks over to the couch._

speaker: Niles
text: I listened to your programme as I was driving home last night. [_holds up two pieces of paper_] Here's a bill to replace the front wheel of my Mercedes, and the second to replace the back bumper of some wretched little domestic car.

speaker: Martin
text: Go easy on your brother, Niles - he's had a rough day.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right, dad. [_sits on the couch; sympathetic_] Er, Frasier, please accept my apologies.  I, I can imagine how trying this must have been for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_unsympathetic again_] 'Course, it's been no picnic for those of us who share your name.  My Maris took it particularly hard.  When I left this morning, she was ordering new stationery with an _accent aigu_ over the "e" in our name. Hereafter, her memos will read, "From the desk of Maris Crane." [_pronounces it, "Crah-nay."_]  _The doorbell rings.  Daphne goes to the door and looks through the peep-hole._

speaker: Daphne
text: Who is it?

speaker: Kate
text: [_outside_] Kate Costas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait!  Alright, all of you.  You know nothing about last night!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello!

speaker: Kate
text: Hello.

speaker: Daphne
text: Come in! _A subdued-looking Kate enters.  Frasier makes some rapid and slightly awkward introductions._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Kate. [_gestures at Niles_] Er, you know Niles, of course. [_gestures at Martin_] Er, this is my...

speaker: Kate
text: [_to Martin_] Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...father, Martin...

speaker: Martin
text: Hi!

speaker: Frasier
text: ...and er, [_points at Daphne_] his healthcare worker. Daphne, Kate Costas.

speaker: Daphne
text: Nice to meet you.

speaker: Kate
text: I'm sorry if I'm coming at a bad time.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, no, I, I - we were just taking Eddie for a walk. [_heads towards the door_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah. [_calls to Eddie_] Eddie!

speaker: Niles
text: I have to be running along too. _Eddie runs up to Daphne.  Niles and Martin join her near the doorway; Martin opens the door._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Eddie_] Oh, what's that on your chin?  Have you been in the garbage again? [_turns to leave_] You Bad Boy! _Everyone freezes, except for bad boy Eddie, who scampers out. Kate is mortified.  After a few moments of very awkward silence, Daphne, Martin and Niles leave hastily, shutting the door behind them._

speaker: Kate
text: So... nice place. [_goes towards the balcony_] Whoa, what a view!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_bitter_] Yes.  I'll be enjoying it during my suspension.

speaker: Kate
text: Well... I guess that concludes the small-talk portion of our evening.  Look, it must be obvious; I've come here to apologise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really - for what?  Turning on me when I went out of my way to protect you?  You know we're both responsible for this. Yet I end up looking like an idiot and you look like a no- nonsense boss!

speaker: Kate
text: Alright, alright, just tell me what I can do to make this right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sulky_] Nothing!  There is nothing you can do, there is nothing you can say, to make this up to me.

speaker: Kate
text: [_no-nonsense_] The owners wanted you fired.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_beat_] That's pretty good! _Frasier feels an odd mixture of shocked relief and embarrassed gratitude._

speaker: Kate
text: Look, there's no way we can rewrite the past.  It happened, we did it, it's on tape.  But we can do this: we can prevent it from ever happening again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Agreed.  Obviously, there's some kind of incredible attraction between us.  The trick will be simply to avoid the opportunity.  We're strong, we're intelligent... and we're alone in this apartment.

speaker: Kate
text: [_anxious_] I'll get my bag!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes...  _RESET TO: the corridor outside Frasier's apartment. Kate emerges and is about to press the button for the elevator when Frasier, following, stops her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Kate, Kate, er, that news crew's probably still in the lobby.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, right!

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me walk you to the service elevator and see you out.  _He shuts the door of his apartment and they leave down a corridor.  CUT TO: outside the service elevator.  The doors are open; inside, items of furniture and assorted junk are stacked around the walls. A moving-man is just leaving.  Kate and Frasier enter and walk in._

speaker: Kate
text: [_to the moving-man_] Going down?

speaker: Man
text: No, you guys go ahead.  Just send it back up!  _The moving-man leaves.  Kate presses a button and the doors close.  CUT TO: inside the elevator as it begins to descend._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes... well, I'm sure if we really try, we can keep things on a professional footing.

speaker: Kate
text: We're two mature adults.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just have to avoid all undue temptation.  _Suddenly, the elevator shudders to a halt and the lights go out, leaving Frasier and Kate in darkness and silence._

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?

speaker: Kate
text: I don't know. [_calls out_] Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, let's have a little light.  _He flicks open his lighter and, by its tiny flame, begins to look around inside the elevator._

speaker: Kate
text: [_calls out_] Hello?  Hello?  Can anybody hear me?  _The moving-man, from somewhere up above, calls down the elevator shaft._

speaker: Man
text: Hello?

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah!  What's going on?  _Frasier, having seen some candles in a corner, begins to light them; gradually, the elevator is illuminated._

speaker: Man
text: Looks like you're stuck.  Same thing happened this morning. Took about half an hour to fix.  You two guys gonna be okay?

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah, yeah, we're fine.  We're adults. [_a little nervous_] We're mature adults! _She glances around herself anxiously.  Frasier, having fired up three candles, burns his hand lighting a fourth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ow! _Nursing his hand, he stumbles against a large object propped up against the back of the elevator, causing it to fall forward and lie flat in the middle of the floorspace.  It turns out to be a large mattress-bed -- big enough to accommodate two.  They eye it uneasily._

speaker: Frasier
text: It's getting sort of hot in here, isn't it?

speaker: Kate
text: [_nervous_] Yeah.  It's a bit - it's a bit hot.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't mind if I take off my jacket, do you?

speaker: Kate
text: [_steadfast_] Makes no difference to me. _Frasier takes off his jacket and drops it onto the mattress; he also loosens his tie._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well.  Looks like we're gonna be here for a little while - may as well try to make ourselves comfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe there are some chairs in here. _They both start looking through the stuff piled up against the sides of the elevator - Frasier on the left-hand side, and Kate on the right. Frasier sees something next to a dressing-table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, here we are!  I'll just have to move this down along...  _He pushes the dressing-table, and from somewhere inside it, a music box begins to play - redolent of bedrooms and romance.  They freeze when they hear it._

speaker: Kate
text: What's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: I must have knocked open a music box in here somewhere. _He opens the dresser.  Inside, he finds fluffy women's panties and an array of high-heeled shoes._

speaker: Kate
text: [_irritable_] I'm not really in the mood for music.  Could you stop that, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I'll try.

speaker: Kate
text: God, it's hot in here! _As she takes off her jacket, Frasier pulls some frilly clothes out of the dresser.  There is the sound of glass breaking against the floor._

speaker: Kate
text: What's that smell?

speaker: Frasier
text: I seem to have broken a bottle of something... [_realizes, gazes at her, worried_] Musk oil...! _Kate is becoming increasingly tense.  Frasier returns to searching the dresser for the source of the music, pulling open the drawers._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_desperate_] Oh, oh, where is that damn music box? [_rifles through another drawer_] Here it is! [_picks it up and turns it off_]

speaker: Kate
text: I really think that it would be a very good thing if you just did something about that musk oil...

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, alright, er, how about... Oh, I know, hand me that drop-cloth there and maybe I can just smother it. _He points at what looks like a dusty, mouldy old piece of curtain hanging behind Kate.  She takes it off of the wall, revealing a large poster of the cover of a romance novel, featuring a muscular, semi-naked hero embracing a voluptuous, semi-naked heroine; above the lovers, a lurid title reads, "Surrender to Bliss," and below them is the name Deirdre Sauvage.  Frasier and Kate, upon seeing it, avert their eyes._

speaker: Kate
text: [_very tense_] Who lives in this building?!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know er, I think we can just forego the musk oil right now.  Why don't you just cover, cover that back up.

speaker: Kate
text: No no no no no, not gonna touch this thing again. [_brushes herself off_] Look at me, I'm all dirty. _Kate freezes and stares at Frasier, who is himself visibly bursting with desire.  Then, finally surrendering to bliss, they dive onto the mattress and grab each other - but, at the last moment, somehow manage to hold back from the usual kissing._

speaker: Kate
text: Ooh, stop - stop - stop!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right!

speaker: Frasier
text: We have gazed into the gaping maw of temptation, and survived!

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, I'm, I'm, I'm proud of us! [_laughs_]

speaker: Kate
text: [_laughs_] I am, too!  God!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relaxed_] Ah...

speaker: Kate
text: Of course, the cable could break.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_tense again_] And we'd be kicking ourselves all the way down...

speaker: Kate
text: You are so right! _They kiss, and just like the previous two times, Frasier ends up lying on top of Kate.  Suddenly, the lights come back on and the elevator begins to descend again.  They hurriedly get up and set about returning the furniture, mattress, clothes, candles, etc., to their original conditions and places.  CUT TO: outside the elevator on the ground floor, several seconds later. A moving-man is waiting.  The doors open.  Everything looks as it did when they first got on, including Frasier's and Kate's attire.  They stand chastely side-by-side, two feet apart._

speaker: Kate
text: [_with businesslike impersonality_] Goodnight, Dr Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_same_] Miss Costas.  _Kate leaves.  The moving-man enters and presses a button.  As the elevator doors close, we see Frasier roll his eyes in relief.  END OF ACT TWO_
